Neither of those optimizations are prohibited by the spec, any more than the spec prohibits optimizing "a++" by modifying the memory location where a is stored.

String values are not the same as string buffers.  The spec doesn't discuss how strings are laid out in memory.  In fact gccgo used to use a different layout, although I have since converted to the gc layout because the old gccgo layout did not permit efficient string slicing.
